benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Remove tags from invoice item

covered: Valid Request scenarios are extensively covered (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04) including empty body handling (204) and specific tag removal behavior
Error handling and input validation (400/404/413/422) covered (TC08, TC09, TC13, TC14, TC15, TC16)
Authorization and authentication scenarios covered (TC10, TC11)
Service availability and integration considerations covered (TC12, TC19)
Edge case: large tagDef input (TC14) and malformed inputs (TC13, TC15, TC16)
Regression/integration with headers including special characters (TC18) and accessibility (TC20)
gaps: Pagination handling for large datasets is not covered (no tests for listing/incremental data or paging when many invoice items or tags exist)
Explicit 403/unauthorized access scenarios beyond token validity (only TC11 covers invalid token; lack of explicit 403 coverage for access rights)
Rate limiting / throttling tests are absent (no tests around rapid consecutive DELETE calls or burst traffic)
Caching behavior tests are missing (no ETag, Cache-Control header validation)
Soft delete semantics or audit trail verification is not explicitly tested (no explicit assertion of logical delete lifecycle or audit log outcomes)
Concurrency/race conditions beyond TC17 high-concurrency performance (no specific race-condition scenarios like delete-after-read on same resource, or conflict resolution)
recommendations: Add pagination tests if endpoint supports paging in related responses or when listing large numbers of items/tags (even if delete targets a single item, ensure behavior remains correct under large dataset conditions)
Introduce explicit authorization/scenario tests for access control beyond authentication token validity (e.g., 403 Forbidden for insufficient permissions)
Add rate limiting/throttling tests to verify system behavior under burst of DELETE requests and proper error handling / status codes
Add caching validation tests to ensure proper ETag handling and Cache-Control headers where applicable
Incorporate soft-delete or audit verification tests to confirm whether deletions are logical vs physical and that audit logs capture the operation
Introduce targeted concurrency tests beyond general performance (e.g., two clients deleting/modifying same invoiceItemId/tags concurrently to validate race handling)
Enhance TC20 with more accessibility-focused checks, such as ensuring error messages are clear to screen readers and that API docs expose accessible examples and schemas
